post_text: Happy Labor Day! On June 28, 1894, Congress passed an act making the first Monday in September a legal holiday in the District of Columbia and the territories. Labor Day celebrates the social and economic achievements of American workers. #happylaborday #laborday #TheLegacyWay

post_text:
How organizations identify and respond to potential cases is crucial in mitigating the spread of COVID-19. In collaboration with state and local health officials, Legacy determines the most appropriate actions while adjusting to meet the unique needs and circumstances of the local community.

The Legacy COVID-19 Emergency Response team is a group of representatives that include Human Resources (HR), Communications, Facilities, and additional personnel who together organize and administer the process of emergency response actions and resolution at Legacy.

post_text:
Legacy Traditional Schools will offer two learning options for students in Arizona for the 2020-2021 school year.

Students must select their learning option by July 19, 2020.

If a student wishes to change their option, a change may only be done at the end of a quarter/grading period, or during a weeklong grace period at the start of the academic calendar.

Select your option, and learn more at https://legacytraditional.org/az-safe-return/

post_text:
This afternoon, Arizona Governor Doug Ducey issued an executive order delaying the start of in-person learning until August 17, 2020, in an effort to slow the spread of COVID-19 in our state. The order impacts the opening of all Legacy schools in Arizona.

Legacy Summer will continue to be offered until further notice. If you have any questions about Legacy Summer, please contact us at communityeducation@legacytraditional.org or visit http://ow.ly/ga1i50Alj9g.

Learn more about this reopening update here: http://ow.ly/oLwc50Alj8V

post_text:
Legacy students can show how much they love their school on Legacy Days with customized school shirts called spirit wear. Display your school spirit and strengthen the Legacy communityby ordering today from the Legacy site or campus PTO or PVO here: https://shop.legacytraditional.org/

And guess what? Starting in the 2020-21 school year, all Legacy Traditional Schools will celebrate Legacy Day every Friday that school is in session. On Legacy Day, students may wear:

✔️ Spirit t-shirts or school sports jerseys (ordered through the Legacy site) in lieu of usual polos.

✔️ Expectations for pants, skirts, jumpers, shoes, outerwear, jewelry, cosmetics and hair will remain the same as a normal school day, with the exception that students may wear athletic shorts that are in dress code colors (red, maroon, white or navy blue) or black.

✔️ Students not wearing spirit t-shirts will be expected to wear their regular uniform polo.

Visit your campus store online today and grab a shirt for the first Legacy Day of the 2020-21 school year! https://shop.legacytraditional.org/

It's official! This week, Arizona joins the nation to celebrate Charter Schools Week from May 10 to May 16!

Help us flood social media with stories, photos and videos highlighting how Legacy and charter schools across the nation, have gone above and beyond to support communities during the coronavirus pandemic.

Post your stories in the comments below, or post on your profiles using #TheLegacyWay #AboveAndBeyondAZ #ClosedNotClosed #CharterSchoolsWeek to show legislators why our schools are making a difference in the lives of every student!

post_text:
Happy Teacher Appreciation Week to all of our Legacy Teachers and Staff!

As an educator and mother, I want you to know how much I appreciate what you do for our students and families. I see first hand the sacrifices you are making at home to make a Legacy education possible for our students each day.

When our students look back on this time in history, they will remember how YOU empowered them, YOU comforted them, YOU taught them, and YOU loved them. YOU, their teachers and staff!

- Miss Kirkley, Superintendent

post_text:
Impress your family at the dinner table with this fun fact! National Kindergarten Day honors Friedrich Wilhelm August Frobel (April 21, 1782 – June 21, 1852) who is credited with starting the very first Kindergarten in Germany in 1837. Frobel was a German teacher and laid a foundation for modern education, recognizing that children learn through play and experience.

Do you know a great kindergarten teacher? Show them how much you appreciate them by saying "thank you" and using the hashtag #NationalKindergartenDay

post_text: Did you know that leisure can be an effective way to both cope with stress and protect against stress’s negative health impacts? In fact, the Psychology, Health & Medicine journal found the "health-protective stress-buffer" effects of leisure coping were evident regardless of people's gender and age!
text: Did you know that leisure can be an effective way to both cope with stress and protect against stress’s negative health impacts? In fact, the Psychology, Health & Medicine journal found the "health-protective stress-buffer" effects of leisure coping were evident regardless of people's gender and age!

post_text:
Self Daily Tip #4:

Upset or overwhelmed? Try this trick to focus on your breathing. Hold out one hand like you are going to give a high-five. Then, hold out the pointer finger of your other hand. Place your pointer finger at the base of your thumb. Slowly breathe in as you trace your finger up your thumb. When you get to the top, slowly breathe out as you trace back down and repeat with each finger!

#TheLegacyWay #ClosedNotClosed
text:
Self Daily Tip #4:

Upset or overwhelmed? Try this trick to focus on your breathing. Hold out one hand like you are going to give a high-five. Then, hold out the pointer finger of your other hand. Place your pointer finger at the base of your thumb. Slowly breathe in as you trace your finger up your thumb. When you get to the top, slowly breathe out as you trace back down and repeat with each finger!

#TheLegacyWay #ClosedNotClosed

post_text:
Legacy Traditional Schools can report that there are no confirmed COVID-19 cases on any Legacy campus, and no report of a confirmed case with any connection to our schools. We are doing everything we can to preserve our academic environment during this time.

To that end, all large student and staff gatherings scheduled between now and April 10 are canceled until further notice, as well as off-campus visits by students and staff to public places where crowds gather. For frequent updates regarding Legacy's response this virus, visit LegacyTraditional.org/COVID-19

post_text:
As Arizona taxpayers, did you know you can claim an Arizona School Tax Credit as a donation to support Legacy Traditional Schools?

That’s right, Arizona taxpayers can claim a credit for donations of up to $400 for a married couple filing jointly, or up to $200 for all other filers!

Donations directly help to fund educational field trips and offset the cost of activities and programs, including musicals, concerts, art shows, spelling bees, speech tournaments, and science fairs.
For more information on the Arizona School Tax Credit, information on contributing to a Legacy school or how to quickly claim your contribution on your Arizona tax return, please visit legacytaxcredit.org.

post_text: At Legacy, we believe active parental involvement is critical to the success of the students and the school. Legacy Traditional Schools strongly encourages, but does not require, parents to volunteer in the classroom, on field trips, during musical productions and during the many events on campus. There may also be opportunities to volunteer from home! Contact our campus for volunteer opportunities and visit https://shop.legacytraditional.org to complete your background screening!

post_text:
You spoke and we listened!

This year, all Legacy Traditional Schools will have one dress down day per quarter. Dates will be sent out soon with more information. There is no fee to participate in dress down day.

Students will have a chance to show their school spirit on Legacy Day on the last Friday of each month that school is in session. On Legacy Day, students may wear spirit T-shirts (purchased through the Legacy site (https://shop.legacytraditional.org/) or PTO/PVO), regular uniform polo, or school shirts that were made in previous years, including school musical shirts, sports jerseys, student council shirts, etc. Expectations for pants, skirts, jumpers, shoes, outerwear, jewelry, cosmetics and hair will remain the same as a normal school day.

Finally, Spirit Week will be held towards the end of the school year. In the spring, students and parents will be able to vote on the theme for each day of Spirit Week.

Again, thank you for your feedback, and let’s get excited for a great, spirited school year!
text:

This year, all Legacy Traditional Schools will have one dress down day per quarter. Dates will be sent out soon with more information. There is no fee to participate in dress down day.

Students will have a chance to show their school spirit on Legacy Day on the last Friday of each month that school is in session. On Legacy Day, students may wear spirit T-shirts (purchased through the Legacy site (https://shop.legacytraditional.org/) or PTO/PVO), regular uniform polo, or school shirts that were made in previous years, including school musical shirts, sports jerseys, student council shirts, etc. Expectations for pants, skirts, jumpers, shoes, outerwear, jewelry, cosmetics and hair will remain the same as a normal school day.

Finally, Spirit Week will be held towards the end of the school year. In the spring, students and parents will be able to vote on the theme for each day of Spirit Week.

Again, thank you for your feedback, and let’s get excited for a great, spirited school year!

SHOP.LEGACYTRADITIONAL.ORG
Legacy Traditional Shop |

post_text:
Families,

Yesterday you should have received an email, or multiple emails (depending on how many children you have enrolled) about how to register for your Titan School Solutions account for school lunch and breakfast. Linking your student's account requires their student ID, which is accessible in the PDF attached to the Titan email.

To access the password protected file, please enter your child's date of birth in the format "mm/dd/yyyy"

Please note that you will need to include the slash marks.

post_text:
For Legacy's 8th Grade Class of 2015 (this year's high school graduating class of 2019), future plans include everything from in-state colleges, to out-of-state universities, military service, mission work, and more. In fact, Legacy's 2015 grads earned a combined $2,900,000 in scholarships to universities across the country!

A group of Legacy's amazing alums met at Topgolf this past weekend for the first-ever Alumni Meet-Up event. Check out the video here: https://youtu.be/CsSdTX8031Y

Families,

Legacy Summer Soccer Camps at Maricopa and Casa Grande starts next week and we still need additional participants to run the program! Seasonal programs are contingent upon registration, so be sure to register today!

July 8 - 12
Monday - Friday
8 to 10 a.m.
Cost: $125/week

Camp is available for enrolled Legacy students in grades K-8.

To learn more about the Academy Directors and to register for an upcoming camp, visit the Legacy Summer Soccer Camps website here: https://clubs.bluesombrero.com/Default.aspx?tabid=482896
